values.description:
The python@2 formula was deleted recently:

* https://github.com/Homebrew/homebrew-core/pull/49796

The sdformat homebrew builds are failing without this change because they want to install `psutil` with pip:

* [![Build Status](https://build.osrfoundation.org/buildStatus/icon?job=sdformat-ci-pr_any-homebrew-amd64&build=1078)](https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/sdformat-ci-pr_any-homebrew-amd64/1078/) https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/sdformat-ci-pr_any-homebrew-amd64/1078/
values.title: brew script: use python3 and pip3

values.description:
The following homebrew-simulation pull request was made from the `osrf` origin repo and not a fork:

* https://github.com/osrf/homebrew-simulation/pull/967

This caused the `generic-release-homebrew_pr_bottle_hash_updater` job to fail to checkout the correct branch since the `origin` and `pr_head` git remotes both had the same branch:

* [![Build Status](https://build.osrfoundation.org/buildStatus/icon?job=generic-release-homebrew_pr_bottle_hash_updater&build=965)](https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/generic-release-homebrew_pr_bottle_hash_updater/965/) https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/generic-release-homebrew_pr_bottle_hash_updater/965/

This PR resolves the ambiguity by explicitly checking out the branch from the `pr_head` remote. The pr has was successfully updated with this branch:

* [![Build Status](https://build.osrfoundation.org/buildStatus/icon?job=generic-release-homebrew_pr_bottle_hash_updater&build=966)](https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/generic-release-homebrew_pr_bottle_hash_updater/966/) https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/generic-release-homebrew_pr_bottle_hash_updater/966/
values.title: use git checkout --track pr_head/branch to avoid ambiguity when remote is origin

summary.raw:
The following homebrew-simulation pull request was made from the `osrf` origin repo and not a fork:

* https://github.com/osrf/homebrew-simulation/pull/967

This caused the `generic-release-homebrew_pr_bottle_hash_updater` job to fail to checkout the correct branch since the `origin` and `pr_head` git remotes both had the same branch:

* [![Build Status](https://build.osrfoundation.org/buildStatus/icon?job=generic-release-homebrew_pr_bottle_hash_updater&build=965)](https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/generic-release-homebrew_pr_bottle_hash_updater/965/) https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/generic-release-homebrew_pr_bottle_hash_updater/965/

This PR resolves the ambiguity by explicitly checking out the branch from the `pr_head` remote. The pr has was successfully updated with this branch:

* [![Build Status](https://build.osrfoundation.org/buildStatus/icon?job=generic-release-homebrew_pr_bottle_hash_updater&build=966)](https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/generic-release-homebrew_pr_bottle_hash_updater/966/) https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/generic-release-homebrew_pr_bottle_hash_updater/966/
summary.html:
The following homebrew-simulation pull request was made from the osrf origin repo and not a fork:

  • https://github.com/osrf/homebrew-simulation/pull/967

This caused the generic-release-homebrew_pr_bottle_hash_updater job to fail to checkout the correct branch since the origin and pr_head git remotes both had the same branch:

  • https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/generic-release-homebrew_pr_bottle_hash_updater/965/

This PR resolves the ambiguity by explicitly checking out the branch from the pr_head remote. The pr has was successfully updated with this branch:

  • https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/generic-release-homebrew_pr_bottle_hash_updater/966/

I believe that with this change the label will expand to 'gpu-nvidia'.

values.description:
The gazebo builds have been failing since pull request #948:

* [![Build Status](https://build.osrfoundation.org/buildStatus/icon?job=gazebo-ci-default-bionic-amd64-gpu-none&build=55)](https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-ci-default-bionic-amd64-gpu-none/55/) https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-ci-default-bionic-amd64-gpu-none/55/

This script isn't used in trusty, so it's safe to just change it to python3.

I've also reproduced the failure with ign-fuel-tools using the `rerun_failed_debug` branch

* 1d7c538 [![Build Status](https://build.osrfoundation.org/buildStatus/icon?job=ignition_fuel-tools-ci-ign-fuel-tools2-bionic-amd64&build=12)](https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ignition_fuel-tools-ci-ign-fuel-tools2-bionic-amd64/12/) https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ignition_fuel-tools-ci-ign-fuel-tools2-bionic-amd64/12/



I've confirmed the fix with ign-fuel-tools and have queued a gazebo build as well.

* b4496ea [![Build Status](https://build.osrfoundation.org/buildStatus/icon?job=ignition_fuel-tools-ci-ign-fuel-tools2-bionic-amd64&build=11)](https://build.osrfoundation.org/view/sw_ignition/job/ignition_fuel-tools-ci-ign-fuel-tools2-bionic-amd64/11/) https://build.osrfoundation.org/view/sw_ignition/job/ignition_fuel-tools-ci-ign-fuel-tools2-bionic-amd64/11/
* [![Build Status](https://build.osrfoundation.org/buildStatus/icon?job=gazebo-ci-default-bionic-amd64-gpu-none&build=56)](https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-ci-default-bionic-amd64-gpu-none/56/) https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-ci-default-bionic-amd64-gpu-none/56/

values.description:
Here’s a basic switch to use colcon as the default instead of catkin\_tools

And I made colcon in the default install list for both ROS 1 and ROS 2  
  
I caught a bug in the python3 adaptation too.

I’m not sure how best to test this.

Fixes #157

values.description:
Gazebo 7 has not been building on Mojave.

I manually changed the label of [this job](https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-ci-gazebo7-homebrew-amd64/) to `osx_highsierra` (at @{557058:5de38267-b118-494c-aa76-4fab35448816}'s suggestion) and it picked a non-mojave machine. Could be luck, or maybe the label works.

I *think* this code would do the right thing, but I'm afraid of running it and breaking stuff. Please advise.
values.title: 👩‍🌾 No Mojave for Gazebo 7

summary.raw:
Gazebo 7 has not been building on Mojave.

I manually changed the label of [this job](https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-ci-gazebo7-homebrew-amd64/) to `osx_highsierra` (at @{557058:5de38267-b118-494c-aa76-4fab35448816}'s suggestion) and it picked a non-mojave machine. Could be luck, or maybe the label works.

I *think* this code would do the right thing, but I'm afraid of running it and breaking stuff. Please advise.
summary.html:
Gazebo 7 has not been building on Mojave.

I manually changed the label of this job to osx_highsierra (at @Steve Peters's suggestion) and it picked a non-mojave machine. Could be luck, or maybe the label works.

I think this code would do the right thing, but I'm afraid of running it and breaking stuff. Please advise.

values.description:
After changing most of the base dependencies to use python3 the gazebo\_ros\_pkgs compilations for ROS1 have been failing for a while. This change should avoid conflicts between python and python3 packages for ROS1 using python2 in all ROS1 installations.

Tested here:

![](https://build.osrfoundation.org/buildStatus/icon?job=ros_gazebo9_pkgs-install_pkg_kinetic-xenial-amd64&build=744)
[https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ros\_gazebo9\_pkgs-install\_pkg\_kinetic-xenial-amd64/744/](https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ros_gazebo9_pkgs-install_pkg_kinetic-xenial-amd64/744/))
values.title: Fix python version for ROS1 installations

values.description:
* Don't set ROS\_PACKAGE\_PATH
* Source install space before trying to roslaunch a launch file in a package we just built

Failing builds

[https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ros\_gazebo\_pkgs-install\_pkg\_kinetic-xenial-amd64/863/](https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ros_gazebo_pkgs-install_pkg_kinetic-xenial-amd64/863/)

[https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ros\_gazebo9\_pkgs-install\_pkg\_kinetic-xenial-amd64/755/](https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ros_gazebo9_pkgs-install_pkg_kinetic-xenial-amd64/755/)

```
multiple files named [rrbot_world.launch] in package [rrbot_gazebo]:
- /var/lib/jenkins/workspace/ros_gazebo_pkgs-install_pkg_kinetic-xenial-amd64/ws/install/rrbot_gazebo/share/rrbot_gazebo/launch/rrbot_world.launch
- /var/lib/jenkins/workspace/ros_gazebo_pkgs-install_pkg_kinetic-xenial-amd64/gazebo_ros_demos/rrbot_gazebo/launch/rrbot_world.launch
Please specify full path instead
The traceback for the exception was written to the log file
```

‌

It seems setting \`ROS\_PACKAGE\_PATH\` causes `roslaunch` to find the package in both the install space and source space. This removes setting `ROS_PACKAGE_PATH` in favor of sourcing the install space.

‌

Fixed builds using this PR

[https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ros\_gazebo\_pkgs-install\_pkg\_kinetic-xenial-amd64/874/](https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ros_gazebo_pkgs-install_pkg_kinetic-xenial-amd64/874/)

[https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ros\_gazebo9\_pkgs-install\_pkg\_kinetic-xenial-amd64/757/console](https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ros_gazebo9_pkgs-install_pkg_kinetic-xenial-amd64/757/console)

‌
values.title: Fix gazebo_ros_pkgs Kinetic  Linux Install jobs

summary.raw:
* Don't set ROS\_PACKAGE\_PATH
* Source install space before trying to roslaunch a launch file in a package we just built

Failing builds

[https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ros\_gazebo\_pkgs-install\_pkg\_kinetic-xenial-amd64/863/](https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ros_gazebo_pkgs-install_pkg_kinetic-xenial-amd64/863/)

[https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ros\_gazebo9\_pkgs-install\_pkg\_kinetic-xenial-amd64/755/](https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ros_gazebo9_pkgs-install_pkg_kinetic-xenial-amd64/755/)

```
multiple files named [rrbot_world.launch] in package [rrbot_gazebo]:
- /var/lib/jenkins/workspace/ros_gazebo_pkgs-install_pkg_kinetic-xenial-amd64/ws/install/rrbot_gazebo/share/rrbot_gazebo/launch/rrbot_world.launch
- /var/lib/jenkins/workspace/ros_gazebo_pkgs-install_pkg_kinetic-xenial-amd64/gazebo_ros_demos/rrbot_gazebo/launch/rrbot_world.launch
Please specify full path instead
The traceback for the exception was written to the log file
```

‌

It seems setting \`ROS\_PACKAGE\_PATH\` causes `roslaunch` to find the package in both the install space and source space. This removes setting `ROS_PACKAGE_PATH` in favor of sourcing the install space.

‌

Fixed builds using this PR

[https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ros\_gazebo\_pkgs-install\_pkg\_kinetic-xenial-amd64/874/](https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ros_gazebo_pkgs-install_pkg_kinetic-xenial-amd64/874/)

[https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ros\_gazebo9\_pkgs-install\_pkg\_kinetic-xenial-amd64/757/console](https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ros_gazebo9_pkgs-install_pkg_kinetic-xenial-amd64/757/console)

‌
summary.html:
• Don't set ROS_PACKAGE_PATH
  • Source install space before trying to roslaunch a launch file in a package we just built

Failing builds

https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ros_gazebo_pkgs-install_pkg_kinetic-xenial-amd64/863/

https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ros_gazebo9_pkgs-install_pkg_kinetic-xenial-amd64/755/

multiple files named [rrbot_world.launch] in package [rrbot_gazebo]:
- /var/lib/jenkins/workspace/ros_gazebo_pkgs-install_pkg_kinetic-xenial-amd64/ws/install/rrbot_gazebo/share/rrbot_gazebo/launch/rrbot_world.launch
- /var/lib/jenkins/workspace/ros_gazebo_pkgs-install_pkg_kinetic-xenial-amd64/gazebo_ros_demos/rrbot_gazebo/launch/rrbot_world.launch
Please specify full path instead
The traceback for the exception was written to the log file

‌

It seems setting `ROS_PACKAGE_PATH` causes roslaunch to find the package in both the install space and source space. This removes setting ROS_PACKAGE_PATH in favor of sourcing the install space.

‌

Fixed builds using this PR

https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ros_gazebo_pkgs-install_pkg_kinetic-xenial-amd64/874/

https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ros_gazebo9_pkgs-install_pkg_kinetic-xenial-amd64/757/console

‌

values.description:
This PR only adds `ros-*-gazebo-ros-control` dependencies if using ROS 1, since `gazebo_ros_control` seems to be part of the `gazebo_ros_pkgs` repo for ROS 1, but does not appear to be a package provided by `gazebo_ros_pkgs` in ROS 2.

See `gazebo_ros_control` in the unported directory:

[https://github.com/ros-simulation/gazebo\_ros\_pkgs/tree/eloquent/.ros1\_unported/gazebo\_ros\_control](https://github.com/ros-simulation/gazebo_ros_pkgs/tree/eloquent/.ros1_unported/gazebo_ros_control)

‌

This is an attempt to fix this job:

[https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ros2\_gazebo\_pkgs-install\_pkg\_eloquent-bionic-amd64/9/](https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ros2_gazebo_pkgs-install_pkg_eloquent-bionic-amd64/9/)

  
While it gets the job farther, it still fails when trying to build `gazebo_ros_demos`.

[https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ros2\_gazebo\_pkgs-install\_pkg\_eloquent-bionic-amd64/10/](https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ros2_gazebo_pkgs-install_pkg_eloquent-bionic-amd64/10/)
values.title: Only install ros-*-gazebo-ros-control in ROS 1

values.description:
A bug in homebrew meant we had to call `brew install --only-dependencies` multiple times (workaround added in pr #924), but that bug has been fixed in [brew#7198](https://github.com/Homebrew/brew/pull/7198) and released in [brew 2.2.11](https://github.com/Homebrew/brew/releases/tag/2.2.11).

[![Build Status](https://build.osrfoundation.org/buildStatus/icon?job=ignition_gazebo-ci-ign-gazebo2-homebrew-amd64&build=99)](https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ignition_gazebo-ci-ign-gazebo2-homebrew-amd64/99/) https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ignition_gazebo-ci-ign-gazebo2-homebrew-amd64/99/
values.title: Call brew install --only-dependencies just once

summary.raw:
A bug in homebrew meant we had to call `brew install --only-dependencies` multiple times (workaround added in pr #924), but that bug has been fixed in [brew#7198](https://github.com/Homebrew/brew/pull/7198) and released in [brew 2.2.11](https://github.com/Homebrew/brew/releases/tag/2.2.11).

[![Build Status](https://build.osrfoundation.org/buildStatus/icon?job=ignition_gazebo-ci-ign-gazebo2-homebrew-amd64&build=99)](https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ignition_gazebo-ci-ign-gazebo2-homebrew-amd64/99/) https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ignition_gazebo-ci-ign-gazebo2-homebrew-amd64/99/
summary.html:
A bug in homebrew meant we had to call brew install --only-dependencies multiple times (workaround added in pr #924), but that bug has been fixed in brew#7198 and released in brew 2.2.11.

https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ignition_gazebo-ci-ign-gazebo2-homebrew-amd64/99/

values.description:
This solves an error \` libGL error: failed to load driver: swrast\` that only seems to happen on `drogon`. As far as I can tell, it looks like it has to do with drogon using `nvidia-docker2`. The nodes using `nvidia-docker` 1 work fine.

Failing job:

[https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-install-gazebo7\_pkg-xenial-amd64/1163/console](https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-install-gazebo7_pkg-xenial-amd64/1163/console)

Successful job with this PR:

[https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-install-gazebo7\_pkg-xenial-amd64/1166/console](https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-install-gazebo7_pkg-xenial-amd64/1166/console)

‌

This PR installs `libglvnd` inside the docker image, which seems to be what the NVidia images do: [https://gitlab.com/nvidia/container-images/opengl/-/blob/ubuntu16.04/glvnd/runtime/Dockerfile](https://gitlab.com/nvidia/container-images/opengl/-/blob/ubuntu16.04/glvnd/runtime/Dockerfile)

‌

It would be nice if this job used osrf/rocker, but that looks like a larger change. [https://github.com/osrf/rocker](https://github.com/osrf/rocker)

‌
values.title: Install libglvnd if using nvidia-docker2

summary.raw:
This solves an error \` libGL error: failed to load driver: swrast\` that only seems to happen on `drogon`. As far as I can tell, it looks like it has to do with drogon using `nvidia-docker2`. The nodes using `nvidia-docker` 1 work fine.

Failing job:

[https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-install-gazebo7\_pkg-xenial-amd64/1163/console](https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-install-gazebo7_pkg-xenial-amd64/1163/console)

Successful job with this PR:

[https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-install-gazebo7\_pkg-xenial-amd64/1166/console](https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-install-gazebo7_pkg-xenial-amd64/1166/console)

‌

This PR installs `libglvnd` inside the docker image, which seems to be what the NVidia images do: [https://gitlab.com/nvidia/container-images/opengl/-/blob/ubuntu16.04/glvnd/runtime/Dockerfile](https://gitlab.com/nvidia/container-images/opengl/-/blob/ubuntu16.04/glvnd/runtime/Dockerfile)

‌

It would be nice if this job used osrf/rocker, but that looks like a larger change. [https://github.com/osrf/rocker](https://github.com/osrf/rocker)

‌
summary.html:
This solves an error ` libGL error: failed to load driver: swrast` that only seems to happen on drogon. As far as I can tell, it looks like it has to do with drogon using nvidia-docker2. The nodes using nvidia-docker 1 work fine.

Failing job:

https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-install-gazebo7_pkg-xenial-amd64/1163/console

Successful job with this PR:

https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-install-gazebo7_pkg-xenial-amd64/1166/console

‌

This PR installs libglvnd inside the docker image, which seems to be what the NVidia images do: https://gitlab.com/nvidia/container-images/opengl/-/blob/ubuntu16.04/glvnd/runtime/Dockerfile

‌

It would be nice if this job used osrf/rocker, but that looks like a larger change. https://github.com/osrf/rocker

‌

values.description:
Fixes a bug I think introduced by this line in pull request #973

[#!/osrf/release-tools/pull-requests/973/install-libglvnd-if-using-nvidia-docker2/diff#Ljenkins-scripts/docker/lib/docker\_generate\_dockerfile.bashT365](#!/osrf/release-tools/pull-requests/973/install-libglvnd-if-using-nvidia-docker2/diff#Ljenkins-scripts/docker/lib/docker_generate_dockerfile.bashT365)

‌

Rosdep fails to install `ros-kinetic-rviz`

Failing build

[https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ros\_gazebo9\_pkgs-install\_pkg\_kinetic-xenial-amd64/760/console](https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ros_gazebo9_pkgs-install_pkg_kinetic-xenial-amd64/760/console)

‌

Waiting on this build to see if this PR fixes the issue:

[https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ros\_gazebo9\_pkgs-install\_pkg\_kinetic-xenial-amd64/761/console](https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ros_gazebo9_pkgs-install_pkg_kinetic-xenial-amd64/760/console)

values.description:
I'm currently working on exporting the release-tools repository to GitHub with [this tool](https://github.com/philipstarkey/bitbucket-hg-exporter), but in the meantime I've made a quick import using github's auto-import feature using a test account:

* https://github.com/scpeters-test/release-tools_auto_import

This branch modifies the DSL code so that the Jenkins jobs will pull release-tools from GitHub rather than bitbucket. It should not be merged; it is just a test for the time being to hopefully streamline the migration. I think the idea is that release-tools would be migrated first, and then a variation of this patch would be applied with the correct repository name immediately after. I think we would also have to manually modify the configuration of https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/_dsl_generate_all_dsls/ to pull from GitHub as well.

I created a new dsl generator job that pulls from the test.dsl file:

* https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/_dsl_test_release_tools_github/1/

It generated the following jobs:

* https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/_test_job_from_dsl/
* https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/_test_job_from_dsl_mac/
* https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/_test_job_from_dsl_win/

Those jobs are trivial and don't actually try to run a script, but the windows script worked at least:

* [![Build Status](https://build.osrfoundation.org/buildStatus/icon?job=_test_job_from_dsl_win&build=1)](https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/_test_job_from_dsl_win/1/) https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/_test_job_from_dsl_win/1/
values.title: [DONTMERGE] Testing release-tools hosted on github

This branch modifies the DSL code so that the Jenkins jobs will pull release-tools from GitHub rather than bitbucket. It should not be merged; it is just a test for the time being to hopefully streamline the migration. I think the idea is that release-tools would be migrated first, and then a variation of this patch would be applied with the correct repository name immediately after. I think we would also have to manually modify the configuration of https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/_dsl_generate_all_dsls/ to pull from GitHub as well.

summary.html:
I'm currently working on exporting the release-tools repository to GitHub with this tool, but in the meantime I've made a quick import using github's auto-import feature using a test account:

  • https://github.com/scpeters-test/release-tools_auto_import

This branch modifies the DSL code so that the Jenkins jobs will pull release-tools from GitHub rather than bitbucket. It should not be merged; it is just a test for the time being to hopefully streamline the migration. I think the idea is that release-tools would be migrated first, and then a variation of this patch would be applied with the correct repository name immediately after. I think we would also have to manually modify the configuration of https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/_dsl_generate_all_dsls/ to pull from GitHub as well.

I created a new dsl generator job that pulls from the test.dsl file:

  • https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/_dsl_test_release_tools_github/1/

It generated the following jobs:

  • https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/_test_job_from_dsl/
  • https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/_test_job_from_dsl_mac/
  • https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/_test_job_from_dsl_win/

Those jobs are trivial and don't actually try to run a script, but the windows script worked at least:

  • https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/_test_job_from_dsl_win/1/
